news_header: Planned strikes on the London Underground have been suspended after pay talks between the Aslef union and Transport for London.
news_text: Planned strikes on the London Underground were suspended following successful pay negotiations between the Aslef union and Transport for London (TfL). The strikes were set to begin on Thursday, with another planned for the following Tuesday. Aslef reported receiving a significantly improved pay offer, which will be discussed with union members. TfL expressed confidence in their fair and affordable offer. The RMT union also called off its planned strike after receiving a pay offer from TfL.
